miaca_schema.json.title: MIACA (Minimum Information about a Cellular Assay) schema

project.description: Conditions that have been established to measure effects which are induced in cells in response to a perturbation, together with data that have been acquired in these measurements in order to address the biological question this project was designed for.

project_description_schema.json.title: MIACA project description schema
project_description_schema.json.description: Description of biological process that is addressed and description of measured effect. Description (text) of the project (1) within a larger context.

title.description: Application title, e. g. as taken from a publication

effect.description: description of measured effect and the 'reporter' used for the measurement (e.g. antibody)

controls.description: controls are relevant in data analysis to determine the robustness and the dynamic range of the assay, and to produce the list of significant hits.e.g. measuring the effect of a perturbation on the induction of apoptosis (biological process), by measuring the level of activated caspase 3 (measured effect), with a antibody specific for the activated enzyme (reporter). One project consists of experiments (>=1) which are carried out in arrays (1 to n features). A proposed definition of experiment is given in The experiment concept above.

xref.description: Refers to the term of the controlled vocabulary in an external database.

xref_schema.json.title: MIACA xref schema
xref_schema.json.description: Crossreference to an external database. Crossreferences to literature databases, e.g. PubMed, should not be put into this structure, but into the bibRef element where possible

primaryRef.description: Primary reference to an external database.

secondaryRef.description: Further external objects describing the object.

db.description: Name of the external database. Taken from the controlled vocabulary of databases.

dbAc.description: Accession number of the database in the database CV. This element is controlled by the PSI-MI controlled vocabulary 'database citation', root term ID MI:0444.

ID.description: Primary Identifier of the object in the external database, e.g. UniProt accession number.

secondary.description: Primary Identifier of the object in the external database, e.g. UniProt accession number.

version.description: The version number of the object in the external database.

refType.description: Reference type, e.g. 'Identity' if this reference refers to an Identical object in the external database, or 'see-also' for additional information. Controlled by CV.

refTypeAc.description: Reference type accession number from the CV of reference types. This element is controlled by the PSI-MI controlled vocabulary 'xref type', root term ID MI:0353.

array_support_schema.json.title: MIACA array support type schema
array_support_schema.json.description: Description of array support types (reaction vessels) that are used during the project: i.e. single eppendorf tube, 96-well plazes, or [glass] slides, with details such as manufacturer, order number; size.

nameType.description: Type of vessel used,: i.e. single eppendorf tube, 96-well plate, etc.

size.description: Size of reaction vessel, e.g. volume or surface area.

vendor.description: Contact details of the source of the reaction vessels, e.g. company

array_support_size_schema.json.title: MIACA array support size type schema
array_support_size_schema.json.description: Size of reaction vessel, e.g. volume or surface area.

vendor_schema.json.title: MIACA vendor type schema
vendor_schema.json.description: Details to the vendor or manufacturer

cell_line_schema.json.title: MIACA cell line schema
cell_line_schema.json.description: Cell line used during the project. An element to describe the cell line used during the project.

cellLineName.description: Description of the cell line used. (e.g. HeLa ATTC CCL2)

cellSource.description: Information about the cellLine if not ATCC

passageNo.description: is the number of generation of a CellLine due to passaging and growing

modifications.description: transgene/genetic manipulations, e.g. stably transfected, induced resistance

validation.description: measures undertaken to validate cell line, e.g. DNA fingerprinting, genotyping, morphology testing

lineQC.description: Mycoplasma test (Y/N) and other measures for quality control, e.g. virus testing

cellLineID.description: Controlled vocabulary ID. Description of the cell line used. (e.g. HeLa ATTC CCL2)

tissue.description: is a collection of interconnected cells that perform a similar function within an organism

source.description: contact details refering to the CellLine

reagent_schema.json.title: MIACA reagent schema
reagent_schema.json.description: A reagent as defined by MIACA, Reagents are media, media supplements, kits, buffers and solutions, water and so on.

ID.description: the identifier of the chemical used as reagent

reagentName.description: the name of the chemical used as reagent

type.description: reagent type, e. g. cDNA, small molecule, siRNA. If available, reference to a controlled vocabulary.

struct.description: e.g. sequence of siRNA; structure/ChEBI for compound

vendor.description: Details to the vendor or manufacturer

targetID.description: e.g. geneID of target gene in case of siRNA

stockConc.description: The value of the reagent stock concentration

stockConcUnit.description: The unit of the stock concentration of the reagent

efficiency.description: e.g., transfection/transduction efficiency of 'cell type' (average, cv) with ‘Perturbator’ (library)

array.description: description of array type and array support type/vessel

libraryRef.description: details on the library the perturbator is part of

titer.description: a numerical expression of the quantity of virus in a given volume

compoundRef.description: details if perturbator is chemincal compound

lipinski.description: % of compound comply with Lipinski rule-of-5

library_schema.json.title: MIACA library type schema
library_schema.json.description: if perturbator is part of a library, a description of the library

prov:wasAttributedTo._comment: an ORCID for now, need to check foaf:Person

type.description: Type of library: (gain-of-function/overexpression (cDNA, ORF, other); loss of function (siRNA, shRNA, miRNA, viral, other); compound; other reference on library (if available)

vendor.description: Details of the vendor or manufacturer

features.description: number of unique features (e.g. genes, compounds) represented in library, reference to where a list of these features can be found

featurePosition.description: PlateNumber and well position; mapping of individual perturbators in library format.

libraryElementCharacteristics.description: LibraryFeatures of perturbators (length of siRNA/shRNA, type of hairpin, other).

composite_reagent_schema.json.title: MIACA composite reagenet schema
composite_reagent_schema.json.description: Composite Reagent. An element to describe the cell line used during the project.

reagent_list_schema.json.title: MIACA reagent schema
reagent_list_schema.json.description: A reagent as defined by MIACA, Reagents are media, media supplements, kits, buffers and solutions, water and so on.
reagent_list_schema.json._comment: TODO: these definitions are the same as in treatment_schema, resolve duplication

instrument_schema.json.title: MIACA instrument schema
instrument_schema.json.description: Description of the instruments required for the assay, e.g. data acquisition station. Detailed descriptions of such instruments and their settings could be part of spezialized documents or be given in Treatment, Post-Treatment, or Data Acquisition.

prov:wasAttributedTo._comment: an ORCID for now, need to check foaf:Person

ID.description: Instrument identifier as stored by the database

instrumentType.description: Instrument type, e.g. liquid handling robot, centrifuge, FACS, Plate Reader, etc.

vendor.description: Details to the vendor or manufacturer, Contact details of the source of the reaction vessels, e.g. company

instrumentSpec.description: e.g. objective lenses, numerical aperture, filters

cell_assay_schema.json.title: MIACA cell assay schema
cell_assay_schema.json.description: The actual experimental part describing the performed steps, like  treatments, perturbation(s) and data acquisition in necessary detail.

treatment.description: Description of the conditions that are applied to CellLine during culturing of cells. ‘Treatment’ also covers the perturbation. More than one perturbator can be applied in the same ‘Treatment’.

postTreatment.description: Description of the conditions, i.e. lysis, fixation, staining, antibody incubation, etc., that may be applied after ‘Treatment’, and prior to data acquisition

dataAcquisition.description: Detection of the effect(s) induced by the perturbation

treatment_schema.json.title: MIACA treatment schema
treatment_schema.json.description: Description of the conditions that are applied to CellLine during culturing of cells. ‘Treatment* also covers the perturbation. More than one perturbator can be applied in the same ‘Treatment’.

ID.description: a UUID for the instance of treatment process

conditionName.description: a reference to an instrument used during the data acquisition

array.description: description of array type and vessel

reagentName.description: the name and characteristics of the chemical used as reagent

compReagentName.description: the name and characteristics of the chemical used as reagent

da_schema.json.title: MIACA data acquisition schema
da_schema.json.description: Detection of the effect(s) induced by the perturbation

prov:wasAttributedTo._comment: an ORCID for now, need to check foaf:Person

ID.description: a UUID for an instance of data acquisition process

instrument.description: a reference to an instrument used during the data acquisition

reference.description: a reference to an publication about the data acquisition

data_processing_schema.json.title: MIACA (Minimum Information about a Cellular Assay) data processing schema
data_processing_schema.json.description: Description of the processes applied to analyze the raw-data in order to generate a hit list. Data analysis is usually carried out sequentially, applying a number of algorithms and analysis tools

processedData.description: The raw data can be processed either manually or through automated computational methods. Processing commonly generates numbers and/or phenotypic descriptions.

software.description: the name of the software used to generate the file

version.description: the version of the softwareused to generate the file

parameters.description: the list of parameter settings used to run the software used to generate the file

phenoDesc.description: A phenotypic description is usually obtained by manual observation of images and/or interpretation of processed data.

protocol.description: for the characterization and classification of phenotypic observation

successorID.description: ID of a successor element of the process step

study_schema.json.title: MIACME study schema
study_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a study in MIACME. A planned activity that consists on study planning, study design execution,  documentation and which produces conclusion(s).

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the study or experiment.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

title.description: A short sentence naming the study.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the study.

contacts.description: The person(s) which contributed to the study, such as the Principal Investigator/corresponding author in publications or other researchers involved.

experimental_setup.description: Set of properties that in combination describe the experiment or experiments in the study.

data.description: The data generated in this study.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the study. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

grant_schema.json.title: MIACME grant schema
grant_schema.json.description: An allocated sum of funds given by a government or other organization for a particular purpose.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

name.description: The name of the grant and its funding program.

funders.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which has awarded the funds supporting the project.

date_schema.json.title: MIACME date schema
date_schema.json.description: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

date.description: A date following the ISO8601 standard.

type.description: The type of date, used to specify the process which is being timestamped by the date attribute value, ideally comes from a controlled terminology.

project_investigation_merged_schema.json.title: MIACA (Minimum Information about a Cellular Assay) project schema - MIACME investigation schema merging
project_investigation_merged_schema.json.description: Merge between the MIACA (Minimum Information about a Cellular Assay) project schema and the MIACME investigation schema

source.description: Contact details of researcher/person/laboratory/institution in charge of the project

projectDescription.description: Description of biological process that is addressed and description of measured effect.

application.description: Description of the specific application of this project within a larger context, if applicable.

arraySupport.description: Array supports (reaction vessels where perturbations are carried out) that are used during the project

materialList.description: Description of the materials that are utilized in the project.

instrument.description: Description of the instruments required for the assay, e.g. data acquisition station. Detailed descriptions of such instruments and their settings could be part of spezialized documents or be given in Treatment, Post-Treatment, or Data Acquisition.

cellAssay.description: The actual experimental part decribing the performed steps, like  treatments, perturbation(s) and data acquisition in necessary detail.

dataProcessing.description: Description of the processes applied to analyze the raw-data in order to generate a hit list. Data analysis is usually carried out sequentially, applying a number of algorithms and analysis tools

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

contacts.description: The person(s) who contributed to the investigation, such as the Principal Investigator, corresponding author in related publications or other researchers involved.

studies.description: The studies associated with the Investigation.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the investigation. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

source_person_merged_schema.json.title: MIACA Source - corresponding to a person and their organization - MIACME person schema. A human being. merging
source_person_merged_schema.json.description: Merge between the MIACA Source - corresponding to a person and their organization and the MIACME person schema. A human being.

name.description: name of the researcher working on the project.

institution.description: name of the institution/affiliation the researcher is working at

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

roles.description: The roles assumed by the person. Ideally from a controlled vocabulary or ontology.

application_publication_merged_schema.js.title: MIACA application JSON schema - MIACME publication schema merging
application_publication_merged_schema.js.description: Merge between the MIACA application JSON schema and the MIACME publication schema

abstract.description: Application abstract, e. g. as taken from a publication

bibref.description: Bibliographic reference for the data generated during the project. Cross reference for the data source. Example: Entry in a database of databases.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

open_cv_annotation_merged_schema.json.title: MIACA open_cv_schema - MIACME annotation schema merging
open_cv_annotation_merged_schema.json.description: Merge between the MIACA open_cv_schema and the MIACME annotation schema

name.description: This contains the controlled vocabulary term

xref.description: Refers to the term of the controlled vocabulary in an external database

value.description: The value of the annotation - it can be a string or a number (for coded values).

valueIRI.description: The IRI of a concept or ontology term associated with the value. It can also be an empty string
